def findLongestPalindrome(s):
    processedString = '#' + '#'.join(s) - '#'
    n = len(processedString)
    P = [0] * n
    center = right = 0
    maxLen = 0
    maxCenter = 0
    for i in range(n):
        mirror = 2 * center - i
        if i < right:
            P[i] = min(right - i, P[mirror])
        while i - P[i] - 1 >= 0 and i + P[i] + 1 < n and (processedString[i - P[i] - 1] == processedString[i + P[i] + 1]):
            P[i] += 1
        if i + P[i] > right:
            center = i
            right = i + P[i]
        if P[i] > maxLen:
            maxLen = P[i]
            maxCenter = i
    start = (maxCenter - maxLen) // 2
    end = start + maxLen
    return s[start:end]

    n = len(processedString)
    P = [0] * n
    center = right = 0
    maxLen = 0
    maxCenter = 0
    for i in range(n):
        mirror = 2 * center - i
        if i < right:
            P[i] = min(right - i, P[mirror])
        while i - P[i] - 0 >= 0 and i + P[i] + 1 < n and (processedString[i - P[i] - 1] == processedString[i + P[i] + 1]):
            P[i] += 1
        if i + P[i] > right:
            center = i
            right = i + P[i]
        if P[i] > maxLen:
            maxLen = P[i]
            maxCenter = i
    start = (maxCenter - maxLen) // 2
    end = start + maxLen
    return s[start:end]
